title: ICE in rustc_resolve::build_reduced_graph::<impl rustc_resolve::Resolver<'a>>::get_module

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I have a proc-macro crate called yardi-derive and a library crate yardi. yardi-derive exports ten macros. If I add an additional macro compilation of yardi-derive succeeds but compilation of yardi panics. Minimal diff of yardi-derive:

`#[proc_macro_derive(huh)] pub fn derive_huh(_input: TokenStream) -> TokenStream { "".parse().unwrap() }`

I've tried writing a minimal test case but have not been able to replicate the problem (yardi is ~15k lines and I'm not sure where to poke around).

Building with `rustc 1.19.0-nightly (5f3966864 2017-05-25)` succeeded and `rustc 1.19.0-nightly (557967766 2017-05-26)` failed, so I built 9ee9abcdb which succeeded and 4f9c9ed1a which failed.

## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:

```
rustc --version --verbose
rustc 1.20.0 (f3d6973f4 2017-08-27)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: f3d6973f41a7d1fb83029c9c0ceaf0f5d4fd7208
commit-date: 2017-08-27
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.20.0
LLVM version: 4.0
```

Backtrace:

```
RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo build
   Compiling yardi-derive v0.1.0 (file:///Users/atj/Projects/yardi/yardi-derive)
   Compiling yardi v0.1.0 (file:///Users/atj/Projects/yardi/yardi)
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.20.0 (f3d6973f4 2017-08-27) running on x86_64-apple-darwin

note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', src/libcore/option.rs:335:20
note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace.
stack backtrace:
   0: std::sys::imp::backtrace::tracing::imp::unwind_backtrace
   1: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}}
   2: std::panicking::default_hook
   3: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook
   4: std::panicking::begin_panic_new
   5: std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt
   6: rust_begin_unwind
   7: core::panicking::panic_fmt
   8: core::panicking::panic
   9: rustc_resolve::build_reduced_graph::<impl rustc_resolve::Resolver<'a>>::get_module
  10: rustc_resolve::build_reduced_graph::<impl rustc_resolve::Resolver<'a>>::macro_def_scope
  11: rustc_resolve::macros::<impl syntax::ext::base::Resolver for rustc_resolve::Resolver<'a>>::resolve_invoc
  12: syntax::ext::expand::MacroExpander::expand
  13: syntax::ext::expand::MacroExpander::expand_crate
  14: rustc_driver::driver::phase_2_configure_and_expand::{{closure}}
  15: rustc_driver::driver::phase_2_configure_and_expand
  16: rustc_driver::driver::compile_input
  17: rustc_driver::run_compiler

error: Could not compile `yardi`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```
